t: For the choir director: on the Gittith. A psalm of the sons of Korah.
How*pn lovely is your dwelling place, Lord*sln of Armies.
I*ln long and yearn for*ln the courts of the Lord;*s my*ln heart and flesh cry out for the living God.
Even*pn a sparrow finds a home, and*ln a swallow, a nest for herself where*ln she places her young — near*ln your altars, Lord*s of Armies, my*ln King and my God.
How*ln happy are those who reside in your house, who*ln praise you continually. Selah*ig
Happy*pn are the people whose strength is in you, whose*ln hearts are set on pilgrimage.
As*ln they pass through the Valley of Baca, they*ln make it a source of spring water; even*ln the autumn rain will cover it with blessings.
They*ln go from strength to strength; each*ln appears before God in Zion.
Lord*spn God of Armies, hear my prayer; listen,*ln God of Jacob. Selah*ig
Consider*ln our shield, God; look*ln on the face of your anointed one.
Better*pn a day in your courts than*ln a thousand anywhere else. I*ln would rather stand at the threshold of the house of my God than*ln live in the tents of wicked people.
For*ln the Lord*s God is a sun and shield. The*ln Lord*s grants favor and honor; he*ln does not withhold the good from*ln those who live with integrity.
Happy*ln is the person who trusts in you, Lord*sln of Armies!
